questions.question: Demography is

choices.answer: Study of the relationship between government & population

questions.question: Arithmetic density is

choices.answer: The number of farmers per square mile of all available land.
The number of farmers per square mile of arable land
The number of people per square mile of arable land
The number of people per unit of measurement

choices.answer: The number of farmers per square mile of arable land
The number of farmers per square mile of all available land
The number of people per square mile of all available land
The number of people per square mile of arable land

choices.answer: The banks along the lower Nile River

choices.answer: Women are more likely to use contraceptives

questions.question: Problems associated with fast population growth in cities include:

choices.answer: An increase in air and water pollution.
Urban slums which result in more poverty and crime
The loss of productive farmland near cities

choices.answer: Max time a given area can support a set level of population
Max # of people that can be supported by resources

questions.question: Which statement about overpopulation is TRUE?

choices.answer: It's unlikely because food production potential is unlimited
occurs when area’s pop. is greater than its carrying cap.
can only occur in less developed areas

choices.answer: Costa Rica’s population is younger than the UK's population.
Costa Rica has more modern health care system than the UK.
The United Kingdom has a higher cancer rate that Costa Rica

questions.question: What is the purpose of an age-sex pyramid?

choices.answer: To show population structure of a country
To show spatial distribution of population
To show life expectance of males and females at birth
To show fertility rate among women in the 20 to 30 age group

choices.answer: The government should encourage pop. growth
Pop. increase will continue by discouraged birth control
The world would soon be over populated

Refugees usually seek to return to their home.

questions.question: The second stage of demographic transition is marked by

choices.answer: declining birth rates, continuing high death rates
high birth rates, quickly declining death rates
high birth rates, high but fluctuating death rates
high birth rates, low and stable death rates

choices.answer: both birth rates and death rates decrease with urbanization
birth rates are unrelated to poverty
birth rates increase but death rates decrease w/urbanization
